meanings.definition: In a state of disrepair or ruin due to old age or neglect.
meanings.sent1: The decrepitly old house had crumbling walls and a sagging roof.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned building looked decrepitly with broken windows and overgrown weeds.
meanings.sent3: The decrepitly car sputtered and coughed as if it had a bad case of the flu.
meanings.sent4: Her decrepitly laptop groaned and protested with each click of the mouse.
meanings.sent5: The decrepitly bridge swayed dangerously in the wind, threatening to collapse at any moment.

meanings.definition: In a feeble or weakened condition, especially due to old age.
meanings.sent1: The decrepitly old man struggled to lift even the lightest of objects.
meanings.sent2: The stray cat looked decrepitly as it limped along the sidewalk, searching for food.
meanings.sent3: The decrepitly dog tried to chase after the squirrel but ended up tripping over its own paws.
meanings.sent4: Her decrepitly voice quivered with emotion as she recounted the tale of her youth.
meanings.sent5: The decrepitly tree swayed in the breeze, its branches barely able to hold the weight of a single bird.
